qas.question: How many commercial airports did the British Airports Authority originally operate?
What group took over the British Airports Authority in 2006?
What group manages the Frankfurt Airport?
Who operates, through joint ventures, Indira Gandhi International Airport?
When was the Airports Authority of India privatized?
In what year was the Airports Authority of India taken over by the Spanish Ferrovial consortium?
How many commercial airports does Fraport in the UK manage?
How many airports did Fraport manage originally in the UK?
What happened to Fraport when it was taken over by the Spanish Ferrovial consortium?

context: Most of the world's airports are owned by local, regional, or national government bodies who then lease the airport to private corporations who oversee the airport's operation. For example, in the United Kingdom the state-owned British Airports Authority originally operated <a0_0><b7_0>eight<b7_0/><a0_0/> of the nation's major commercial airports - it was subsequently privatized <b4_0>in the late 1980s<b4_0/>, and following its takeover by the <a1_0>Spanish Ferrovial consortium<a1_0/> in <b5_0>2006<b5_0/>, has been <b8_0>further divested and downsized<b8_0/> to operating just <b6_0>five<b6_0/>. Germany's Frankfurt Airport is managed by the quasi-private firm <a2_0>Fraport<a2_0/>. While in India <a3_0>GMR Group<a3_0/> operates, through joint ventures, Indira Gandhi International Airport and Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. Bengaluru International Airport and Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport are controlled by GVK Group. The rest of India's airports are managed by the Airports Authority of India.
